abstract.text: Clips a tensor’s values to a maximum Euclidean norm.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The dimensions that the function uses to compute the Euclidean norm. Set to
for the function to compute the norm over all dimensions.
Use this function to clip the values in an input tensor to a maximum Euclidean norm. The Euclidean norm is the square root of the sum of squares of the two tensors.
The function supports clipping across the entire tensor or by the norms of the dimension you specify.
The following code clips the values on axis
are both less than 10, and function returns them unchanged. However, the Euclidean norm of
is greater than 10, and the function returns them scaled accordingly.
